p: While ELISA can be used to monitor changes of antibody levels in field herds under clinical situations, it can also be used retrospectively to detect viruses and IgA/IgG levels in serum to provide guidance for vaccine use. The ELISA detection methods for SeACoV are only available for use in the laboratory, for the epidemiological investigation of the initial virus outbreak and reemergence ( Table 2). The ELISA uses a luciferase immunoprecipitation system based on the S1 protein, and has been used to investigate possible zoonotic transmission ( Zhou et al., 2018b). In addition, there is a virion-based ELISA detection method designed for sample detection in mouse model experiments, which can also be used for pig serum samples ( Yang et al., 2019b).
